translation: (1) Woe to every scorner and mocker
(2) Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.[1987]
footnotes: [1987]- Rather than spending in the way of Allāh.

translation: (3) He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
(4) No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.[1988]
footnotes: [1988]- i.e., Hellfire, which crushes and destroys all that enters it.

translation: (5) And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
(6) It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,
(7) Which mounts directed at the hearts.[1989]
(8) Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them

footnotes: [1990]- Interpreted to be either columns of fire or columns of iron to which are chained the inmates of Hell.
